text: The 1965–66 season was Cardiff City F.C.'s 39th season in the Football League. They competed in the 22-team Division Two, then the second tier of English football, finishing twentieth. The season also saw the club reach the semi- finals of the Football League Cup, the furthest they have ever gone in the competition, before being beaten by West Ham United. ==Players== ==League standings== ==European Cup Winners Cup== {| class="wikitable" |+ !Date!!Round!!Opponent!!Venue!!Result!!Attendance!!Scorers |- | 8 Sep || One (first leg) || Standard Liege || H || L 1 – 2 || 12,738 || Johnston |- | 20 Oct || One (second leg) || Standard Liege || A || L 0 – 1 || 17,985 || |} ==See also== *Cardiff City F.C. seasons ==References== * * *Welsh Football Data Archive Category:Cardiff City F.C. seasons Category:Association football clubs 1965–66 season Card
title: 1965–66 Cardiff City F.C. season
